qas.question: What company mines salt in Detroit?
How many acres is the Windsor Salt Mine?
How many routes to Canada does Detroit have?
What is the railway tunnel to Canada called?
What it the Ferry to Canada called?

context: Detroit has <a2_0>four<a2_0/> border crossings: the Ambassador Bridge and the Detroit–Windsor Tunnel provide motor vehicle thoroughfares, with the <a3_0>Michigan Central Railway Tunnel<a3_0/> providing railroad access to and from Canada. The fourth border crossing is the <a4_0>Detroit–Windsor Truck Ferry<a4_0/>, located near the Windsor Salt Mine and Zug Island. Near Zug Island, the southwest part of the city was developed over a <a1_0>1,500<a1_0/>-acre (610 ha) salt mine that is 1,100 feet (340 m) below the surface. The <a0_0>Detroit Salt Company<a0_0/> mine has over 100 miles (160 km) of roads within.
